item.title: Hashing It Out #98-ETH 2.0 Panel After The Launch
item.dc:creator: Alycia Snow
item.description: Jaye and Corey lead a panel discussion about the Aftermath of The Beacon Chain Launch for ETH 2.0. Panel members are Ben Edington (ConsenSys) and Gregory Markou(ChainSafe). item.title: Hashing It Out #82- The Transition with Dean & John
item.dc:creator: Alycia Snow
item.description: This Episode is Collin Cusce, Swan Song, as he leaves Hashing It Out to focuses on his work at AVA Labs. With Collin leaving, he passes the torch to the two new hosts Dean Eigenmann of Status and John Mardlin [Maurelian] of Consensys. Thank You, Collin, for your diligent work and excellent insight as the […]

item.title: Hashing It Out #79- Alex Masmejean Rocket NFT/MetaCartel
item.dc:creator: Alycia Snow
item.description: Alex is part of MetaCartel, a group of developers seeking to make Dapps decentralize as possible, beginning with their developers. Alex is also part of Rocket NFT, a company that aims to create Defi loans using NTFs as collateral. Links: Website- Metacartel Twitter- Metacartel Hackathon- Metacartel Twitter- Rocket NFT Twitter- Alexmasmej Sponsor Status Website Status […]

item.title: BlockChannel #66 – Cameron Robertson & Paul Gerhardt – Kong Cash
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: On this episode of BlockChannel, McKie, Dee and Dr. Petty join the founders Cameron Robertson (CEO) and Paul Gerhardt (CTO) to discuss what we believe is an innovation in bridging digital money with physical, secure digital hardware. They present us Kong, their digital cash equivalent: possessing the ability to act as a fungible representation of […]

item.title: BlockChannel #65 – Crypto Product Engineers, with Austin Griffith
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: On this episode of BlockChannel, McKie and Dr. Petty have a friendly chat with your favorite neighborhood developer, Austin Griffith. Creator of the burner wallet, Austin is one of the leading developers focused on usability and creating the “aha!” moments necessary to bridge traditional software developers and consumers, over into the bright and bountiful world […]
